name: good karma cowl
notes:
*please get an updated copy for the correction of some typos - **the file name should say good karma cowl 3.1***
***thank you to those early knitters for providing such wonderful feedback!***

✨radiate positive vibes with this quick and simple knit – the good karma cowl, a free pattern designed to bring warmth to both your neck and your heart!✨

the good karma cowl pattern is thoughtfully crafted to be beginner-friendly, ensuring that everyone can join in the joy of creating their own cozy accessory. as you knit, infuse each stitch with good intentions, turning your crafting time into a moment of positive energy.

this cowl is also terrific for picking your very own fan colors to represent those favorite teams 🏈 at the cold games this season. or maybe school colors for those students in your life.

perfect for holiday gifts, share the love by gifting your cowl to a friend – let the ripple of good karma continue!


this pattern is available as a free download. all i ask in return, if you are downloading this pattern, please favorite it or add it to your queue. thank you so much 💖

**yarn:** emma’s yarn super silky (80% superwash merino/20% silk, 400yards/100grams)  
color 1 (c1) – after party – 325 yards

practically perfect smalls (80% superwash merino/20% nylon, 81yards/20grams)  
color 2 (c2) -trendy af – 50 yards
color 3 (c3) -set sail – 50 yards

**needles:** us4/3.5mm 24” circular needles 

**notions:** 3 stitch marker, tapestry needle, t-pins and for blocking. 

**gauge:** 24 stitches = 4 inches in stockinette stitch after gentle blocking. although gauge is not crucial for this project, it will affect the finished size and yarn requirements. a looser gauge will result in the use of more yarn. 

**finished size:** 20” neck opening after blocking
